baseline_groups.claim_summary: Sea distance has a negative effect on bilateral trade flows (distance elasticity of trade), estimated via gravity equation regressions. The baseline gravity specification with standard controls yields a distance elasticity around -1.1.
baseline_groups.notes: Five baseline specs replicate Table A11 structure: (1) bivariate sea distance only, (2) standard gravity with GDP+bilateral controls, (3) origin FE only, (4) two-way FE no controls, (5) two-way FE with bilateral controls. The primary baseline is baseline_gravity which matches the standard gravity specification.

global_notes: Paper estimates gravity equations for bilateral trade. The 74 specifications all relate to the single core claim about the distance elasticity of trade. Alternative treatment specs (weighted distance, contiguity, colony) and alternative outcome specs (trade quantity, trade intensity) are classified as noncore because they test different claims (different coefficient interpretations) even though the underlying regression structure is similar. Placebo tests with scrambled distance or non-trade outcomes are noncore. Heterogeneity interaction specs test whether the distance effect varies by subgroup, not whether the baseline distance effect exists, so they are noncore. Specs with trade_intensity outcome (r_squared = -Inf) appear to have estimation issues and are classified as invalid.
